title: The typhoon-enforced cancellation of Le Crunch has done nothing to harm England's World Cup chances
text:
On the bright side, England will have to win six games to be world champions rather than seven and are virtually guaranteed to avoid Wales in next week’s quarter-finals. No wonder Eddie Jones wondered whether the “typhoon gods” were smiling on him.

From the 43rd floor of England’s Tokyo hotel on Thursday morning the sky was calm and the horizon undisturbed. But Typhoon Hagibis was still heading our way and World Rugby had just cancelled the England-France and New Zealand-Italy games while leaving Sunday’s potentially thrilling clash between Japan and Scotland in the balance. Swiftly...
description: On the bright side, England will have to win six games to be world champions rather than seven and are virtually guaranteed to avoid Wales in next week’s quarter-finals.
